content.raw:
It doesn't seem to work with particle types created via a particle filter.

script: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5015/

traceback: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5016/

It *does* work with the `DarkMatter` particle type (using this script: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5017/).  On my laptop that script takes about 6 minutes to run.

It's not clear to me how to call `add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field` outside of a frontend (my best attempt is here: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5018/, although that fails with a `KeyError` when it tries to find units for the `smooth_density` field when I try to add it). Just in case you weren't already planning on it, can you add an example?

Sorry for all the gripes - this is really cool!  It will be the base for a lot of cool analysis going forward.
content.html:
It doesn't seem to work with particle types created via a particle filter.

script: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5015/

traceback: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5016/

It does work with the DarkMatter particle type (using this script: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5017/). On my laptop that script takes about 6 minutes to run.

It's not clear to me how to call add_volume_weighted_smoothed_field outside of a frontend (my best attempt is here: http://paste.yt-project.org/show/5018/, although that fails with a KeyError when it tries to find units for the smooth_density field when I try to add it). Just in case you weren't already planning on it, can you add an example?

Sorry for all the gripes - this is really cool! It will be the base for a lot of cool analysis going forward.

content.raw: Since `fake_random_ds` requires an `ndims` argument, do you think it makes sense to have `fake_particle_ds` require an `nparts` argument?  Or perhaps what you've done here is a better standard (using `nparts=16^3` as a kwarg), and in a future PR, we should move `fake_random_ds` to be `fake_grid_ds` with no required arg (but retain an alias of `fake_random_ds` that wraps to it)?
content.html: Since fake_random_ds requires an ndims argument, do you think it makes sense to have fake_particle_ds require an nparts argument? Or perhaps what you've done here is a better standard (using nparts=16^3 as a kwarg), and in a future PR, we should move fake_random_ds to be fake_grid_ds with no required arg (but retain an alias of fake_random_ds that wraps to it)?

description:
This is a draft of a nearest neighbor field.

Note that there are a few changes in this.  The first is that I was finding sometimes the nneighbors searching was not enough to get all of the nearest neighbors for a particle.  This was causing issues for particle-particle correlation (but not for smoothing lengths and the like, is my assertion, since we normalize.)  The second is that I've added a periodicity check for neighbor finding.

And, it's now tested.  This is ready for review.

UPDATE N: Addressed the comments, and I will try to get particle filters working, but not sure it can make it in.
